TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ContentType extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a MIME protocol Content-Type header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The information in the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> class is used to describe the data contained in an email message in such a way that software that displays email can present the content in an appropriate manner. <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> is used with the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment> class to specify the type of content in the attachment.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. RFC 2046 provides detailed information about MIME media types and their parameters. These RFCs are available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example sends an email message with an attachment and displays the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.ContentDisposition%2A> properties for the attachment.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Boundary { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Boundary : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the boundary parameter included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A that contains the value associated with the boundary parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Boundary%2A> parameter is "`-----boundary---0`".
`content-type: multipart/mixed; boundary=-----boundary---0`
Set this property to `null` or <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType> to remove the boundary information from the header.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. An in-depth discussion of the boundary parameter is contained in RFC 2046 Section 5.1.1. These RFCs are available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the value of the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Boundary%2A> property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ CharSet { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.CharSet : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the charset parameter included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A that contains the value associated with the charset parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.CharSet%2A> property is "`us-ascii`".
`content-type: application/x-myType; charset=us-ascii`
Set this property to `null` or <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType> to remove the charset information from the header.
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. An in-depth discussion of the charset parameter is contained in RFC 2046 Section 4.1.2. These RFCs are available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the value of the property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ MediaType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.MediaType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the media type value included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A that contains the media type and subtype value. This value does not include the semicolon (;) separator that follows the subtype.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.MediaType%2A> property is `"application/x-myType"`.
`content-type: application/x-myType; name=data.xyz`
Set this property to `null` or <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType> to remove the name information from the header.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. RFC 2046 provides detailed information on MIME media types. These RFCs are available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example sets the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#13](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#13)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#13)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Name : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the name parameter included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A that contains the value associated with the name parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the following example of a Content-Type header, the value of the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Name%2A> property is `"data.xyz"`.
`content-type: application/x-myType; name=data.xyz`
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1, available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
When specifying content for a <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment> as a <xref:System.IO.Stream> or <xref:System.String>, you can use <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Name%2A> to set the name of the file that stores the content on the recipient's system.
## Examples The following code example sets the value of the property to specify a name for a file being attached as a stream.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#15](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#15)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#15)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parameters As StringDictionary

Docs.summary: Gets the dictionary that contains the parameters included in the Content-Type header represented by this instance.
Docs.value: A writable that contains name and value pairs.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set the parameters by specifying the entire Content-Header value when constructing a <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> object or you can add parameters to the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.StringDictionary> returned by the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Parameters%2A> property.
When adding a parameter entry to the dictionary, the name of the parameter is the entry's key and the value of the parameter is the entry's value.
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1. RFC 2046 provides detailed information on MIME media types and their associated parameters. These RFCs are available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the values in the dictionary returned by this property.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of this object.
Docs.returns: A that contains the current settings for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.ToString%2A> method contains the string used to create this <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType>, if one was specified and no property values have been changed. If no string was specified, or one or more property values have changed since this <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> was created, the value of <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.ToString%2A> is a string in the format of a Content-Type header that is composed using the current property values. The string does not include the `"Content-type:"` prefix.
The syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1, available at [https://www.ietf.org](https://www.ietf.org/).
## Examples The following code example displays the string representation of a <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType>.
[!code-cpp[NclMailSync#13](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CPP/NclMailSync.cpp#13)] [!code-csharp[NclMailSync#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLMailSync/CS/mail.cs#13)]
